title: Development and Application of Self-directed Language Learning Strategies in Blended Learning Environments

context.prior_knowledge: Basic language proficiency (grammar, vocabulary, communication fundamentals), basic digital device skills, experience in text comprehension and writing, and foundational awareness of diverse cultural contexts
context.additional_context: Customized language course for adults emphasizing interaction via online discussions and peer assessments. Includes activities for expressive/reading skill development, cultural context understanding (cross-cultural analysis, situational expression practice), and digital literacy tool training.

learning_goals: In blended learning environments, learners independently plan self-directed study ≥3 times weekly using online resources/tools (language apps, digital texts), setting vocabulary expansion and grammatical structure goals (verb conjugation, complex sentence construction, etc.)

Learners participate in ≥3 real-time online discussions (20 minutes/session) weekly, providing specific feedback meeting ≥4 of 5 peer evaluation criteria (grammatical accuracy, pronunciation clarity, expression diversity, text structure consistency, cultural appropriateness)

Through project-based assessments (e.g., portfolio creation), learners systematically document self-reflection and learning outcomes (reading comprehension improvement, writing skill development, vocabulary utilization increase, etc.) and visualize text analysis results in graphical formats (graphs, tables)
difficulty: Easy - Simple structure with minimal constraints
